FuncDef:
The c-multicast signaling command configures the signaling protocol for transmitting C-multicast routes.
The undo c-multicast signaling command deletes the signaling protocol for transmitting C-multicast routes.
By default, no signaling protocol is configured for transmitting C-multicast routes.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family MVPN view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies BGP as the signaling protocol for transmitting C-multicast routes.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a next-generation multicast virtual private network (NG MVPN), PIM is not configured on the public network, and therefore the receiver provider edge (PE) converts the received PIM Join/Prune messages or IGMP Join message from the VPN to C-multicast routes and sends the routes to the sender PE. To configure the signaling protocol for transmitting C-multicast routes, run the c-multicast signaling command.
Precautions
Only BGP can be used as the signaling protocol for transmitting C-multicast routes.
